speaker: YORK
text_entry: SCENE II. Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter certain Murderers, hastily

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Run to my Lord of Suffolk; let him know

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: We have dispatch'd the duke, as he commanded.

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: O that it were to do! What have we done?

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: Didst ever hear a man so penitent?

speaker: Second Murderer
text_entry: Enter SUFFOLK

speaker: First Murder
text_entry: Here comes my lord.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Now, sirs, have you dispatch'd this thing?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Ay, my good lord, he's dead.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Why, that's well said. Go, get you to my house;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I will reward you for this venturous deed.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The king and all the peers are here at hand.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Have you laid fair the bed? Is all things well,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: According as I gave directions?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: 'Tis, my good lord.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Away! be gone.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exeunt Murderers

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sound trumpets. Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN MARGARET, CARDINAL, SOMERSET, with Attendants

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Go, call our uncle to our presence straight;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Say we intend to try his grace to-day.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If he be guilty, as 'tis published.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I'll call him presently, my noble lord.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Lords, take your places; and, I pray you all,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Proceed no straiter 'gainst our uncle Gloucester

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Than from true evidence of good esteem

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: He be approved in practise culpable.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: God forbid any malice should prevail,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That faultless may condemn a nobleman!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Pray God he may acquit him of suspicion!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I thank thee, Meg; these words content me much.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Re-enter SUFFOLK

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: How now! why look'st thou pale? why tremblest thou?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Where is our uncle? what's the matter, Suffolk?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Dead in his bed, my lord; Gloucester is dead.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Marry, God forfend!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: God's secret judgment: I did dream to-night

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: The duke was dumb and could not speak a word.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: KING HENRY VI swoons

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How fares my lord? Help, lords! the king is dead.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Rear up his body; wring him by the nose.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Run, go, help, help! O Henry, ope thine eyes!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: He doth revive again: madam, be patient.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O heavenly God!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How fares my gracious lord?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Comfort, my sovereign! gracious Henry, comfort!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What, doth my Lord of Suffolk comfort me?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Came he right now to sing a raven's note,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whose dismal tune bereft my vital powers;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And thinks he that the chirping of a wren,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: By crying comfort from a hollow breast,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Can chase away the first-conceived sound?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Hide not thy poison with such sugar'd words;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Lay not thy hands on me; forbear, I say;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Their touch affrights me as a serpent's sting.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Thou baleful messenger, out of my sight!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Upon thy eye-balls murderous tyranny

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Sits in grim majesty, to fright the world.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Look not upon me, for thine eyes are wounding:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Yet do not go away: come, basilisk,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And kill the innocent gazer with thy sight;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For in the shade of death I shall find joy;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: In life but double death, now Gloucester's dead.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Why do you rate my Lord of Suffolk thus?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Although the duke was enemy to him,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Yet he most Christian-like laments his death:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And for myself, foe as he was to me,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Might liquid tears or heart-offending groans

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or blood-consuming sighs recall his life,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I would be blind with weeping, sick with groans,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Look pale as primrose with blood-drinking sighs,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And all to have the noble duke alive.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What know I how the world may deem of me?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For it is known we were but hollow friends:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: It may be judged I made the duke away;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: So shall my name with slander's tongue be wounded,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And princes' courts be fill'd with my reproach.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: This get I by his death: ay me, unhappy!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To be a queen, and crown'd with infamy!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Ah, woe is me for Gloucester, wretched man!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Be woe for me, more wretched than he is.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What, dost thou turn away and hide thy face?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I am no loathsome leper; look on me.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What! art thou, like the adder, waxen deaf?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Be poisonous too and kill thy forlorn queen.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is all thy comfort shut in Gloucester's tomb?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Why, then, dame Margaret was ne'er thy joy.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Erect his statue and worship it,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And make my image but an alehouse sign.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Was I for this nigh wreck'd upon the sea

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And twice by awkward wind from England's bank

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Drove back again unto my native clime?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What boded this, but well forewarning wind

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Did seem to say 'Seek not a scorpion's nest,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Nor set no footing on this unkind shore'?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What did I then, but cursed the gentle gusts

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And he that loosed them forth their brazen caves:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And bid them blow towards England's blessed shore,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or turn our stern upon a dreadful rock

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Yet AEolus would not be a murderer,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But left that hateful office unto thee:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The pretty-vaulting sea refused to drown me,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Knowing that thou wouldst have me drown'd on shore,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: With tears as salt as sea, through thy unkindness:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The splitting rocks cower'd in the sinking sands

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And would not dash me with their ragged sides,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Because thy flinty heart, more hard than they,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Might in thy palace perish Margaret.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: As far as I could ken thy chalky cliffs,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: When from thy shore the tempest beat us back,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I stood upon the hatches in the storm,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And when the dusky sky began to rob

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: My earnest-gaping sight of thy land's view,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I took a costly jewel from my neck,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: A heart it was, bound in with diamonds,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And threw it towards thy land: the sea received it,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And so I wish'd thy body might my heart:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And even with this I lost fair England's view

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And bid mine eyes be packing with my heart

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And call'd them blind and dusky spectacles,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For losing ken of Albion's wished coast.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: How often have I tempted Suffolk's tongue,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The agent of thy foul inconstancy,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To sit and witch me, as Ascanius did

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: When he to madding Dido would unfold

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His father's acts commenced in burning Troy!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Am I not witch'd like her? or thou not false like him?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ay me, I can no more! die, Margaret!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For Henry weeps that thou dost live so long.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Noise within. Enter WARWICK, SALISBURY, and many Commons

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: It is reported, mighty sovereign,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That good Duke Humphrey traitorously is murder'd

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: By Suffolk and the Cardinal Beaufort's means.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The commons, like an angry hive of bees

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That want their leader, scatter up and down

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And care not who they sting in his revenge.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Myself have calm'd their spleenful mutiny,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Until they hear the order of his death.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That he is dead, good Warwick, 'tis too true;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But how he died God knows, not Henry:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Enter his chamber, view his breathless corpse,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And comment then upon his sudden death.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That shall I do, my liege. Stay, Salisbury,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: With the rude multitude till I return.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O Thou that judgest all things, stay my thoughts,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My thoughts, that labour to persuade my soul

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Some violent hands were laid on Humphrey's life!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If my suspect be false, forgive me, God,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For judgment only doth belong to thee.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Fain would I go to chafe his paly lips

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: With twenty thousand kisses, and to drain

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Upon his face an ocean of salt tears,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To tell my love unto his dumb deaf trunk,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And with my fingers feel his hand unfeeling:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But all in vain are these mean obsequies;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And to survey his dead and earthly image,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What were it but to make my sorrow greater?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Re-enter WARWICK and others, bearing GLOUCESTER'S body on a bed

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Come hither, gracious sovereign, view this body.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That is to see how deep my grave is made;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For with his soul fled all my worldly solace,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For seeing him I see my life in death.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: As surely as my soul intends to live

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: With that dread King that took our state upon him

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: To free us from his father's wrathful curse,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: I do believe that violent hands were laid

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Upon the life of this thrice-famed duke.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A dreadful oath, sworn with a solemn tongue!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: What instance gives Lord Warwick for his vow?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: See how the blood is settled in his face.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Oft have I seen a timely-parted ghost,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Of ashy semblance, meagre, pale and bloodless,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Being all descended to the labouring heart;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Who, in the conflict that it holds with death,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Attracts the same for aidance 'gainst the enemy;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Which with the heart there cools and ne'er returneth

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: To blush and beautify the cheek again.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: But see, his face is black and full of blood,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: His eye-balls further out than when he lived,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Staring full ghastly like a strangled man;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: His hair uprear'd, his nostrils stretched with struggling;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: His hands abroad display'd, as one that grasp'd

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And tugg'd for life and was by strength subdued:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Look, on the sheets his hair you see, is sticking;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: His well-proportion'd beard made rough and rugged,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Like to the summer's corn by tempest lodged.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: It cannot be but he was murder'd here;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The least of all these signs were probable.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Why, Warwick, who should do the duke to death?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Myself and Beaufort had him in protection;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And we, I hope, sir, are no murderers.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: But both of you were vow'd Duke Humphrey's foes,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And you, forsooth, had the good duke to keep:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: 'Tis like you would not feast him like a friend;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And 'tis well seen he found an enemy.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Then you, belike, suspect these noblemen

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: As guilty of Duke Humphrey's timeless death.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Who finds the heifer dead and bleeding fresh

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And sees fast by a butcher with an axe,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: But will suspect 'twas he that made the slaughter?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Who finds the partridge in the puttock's nest,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: But may imagine how the bird was dead,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Although the kite soar with unbloodied beak?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Even so suspicious is this tragedy.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Are you the butcher, Suffolk? Where's your knife?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is Beaufort term'd a kite? Where are his talons?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I wear no knife to slaughter sleeping men;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But here's a vengeful sword, rusted with ease,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That shall be scoured in his rancorous heart

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That slanders me with murder's crimson badge.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Say, if thou darest, proud Lord of Warwick-shire,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That I am faulty in Duke Humphrey's death.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exeunt CARDINAL, SOMERSET, and others

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: What dares not Warwick, if false Suffolk dare him?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: He dares not calm his contumelious spirit

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Nor cease to be an arrogant controller,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Though Suffolk dare him twenty thousand times.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Madam, be still; with reverence may I say;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: For every word you speak in his behalf

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Is slander to your royal dignity.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Blunt-witted lord, ignoble in demeanor!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If ever lady wrong'd her lord so much,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thy mother took into her blameful bed

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Some stern untutor'd churl, and noble stock

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Was graft with crab-tree slip; whose fruit thou art,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And never of the Nevils' noble race.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: But that the guilt of murder bucklers thee

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And I should rob the deathsman of his fee,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Quitting thee thereby of ten thousand shames,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And that my sovereign's presence makes me mild,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: I would, false murderous coward, on thy knee

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Make thee beg pardon for thy passed speech,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And say it was thy mother that thou meant'st

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That thou thyself was born in bastardy;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And after all this fearful homage done,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Give thee thy hire and send thy soul to hell,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Pernicious blood-sucker of sleeping men!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thou shall be waking well I shed thy blood,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If from this presence thou darest go with me.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Away even now, or I will drag thee hence:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Unworthy though thou art, I'll cope with thee

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And do some service to Duke Humphrey's ghost.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Exeunt SUFFOLK and WARWICK

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What stronger breastplate than a heart untainted!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Thrice is he armed that hath his quarrel just,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And he but naked, though lock'd up in steel

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whose conscience with injustice is corrupted.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: A noise within

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What noise is this?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Re-enter SUFFOLK and WARWICK, with their weapons drawn

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Why, how now, lords! your wrathful weapons drawn

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Here in our presence! dare you be so bold?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Why, what tumultuous clamour have we here?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The traitorous Warwick with the men of Bury

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Set all upon me, mighty sovereign.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: [To the Commons, entering]  Sirs, stand apart;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: the king shall know your mind.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Dread lord, the commons send you word by me,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Unless Lord Suffolk straight be done to death,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Or banished fair England's territories,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: They will by violence tear him from your palace

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And torture him with grievous lingering death.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: They say, by him the good Duke Humphrey died;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: They say, in him they fear your highness' death;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And mere instinct of love and loyalty,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Free from a stubborn opposite intent,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: As being thought to contradict your liking,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Makes them thus forward in his banishment.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: They say, in care of your most royal person,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That if your highness should intend to sleep

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And charge that no man should disturb your rest

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: In pain of your dislike or pain of death,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Yet, notwithstanding such a strait edict,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Were there a serpent seen, with forked tongue,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That slily glided towards your majesty,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: It were but necessary you were waked,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Lest, being suffer'd in that harmful slumber,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The mortal worm might make the sleep eternal;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And therefore do they cry, though you forbid,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That they will guard you, whether you will or no,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: From such fell serpents as false Suffolk is,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: With whose envenomed and fatal sting,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Your loving uncle, twenty times his worth,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: They say, is shamefully bereft of life.

speaker: Commons
text_entry: [Within]  An answer from the king, my

speaker: Commons
text_entry: Lord of Salisbury!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: 'Tis like the commons, rude unpolish'd hinds,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Could send such message to their sovereign:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But you, my lord, were glad to be employ'd,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To show how quaint an orator you are:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But all the honour Salisbury hath won

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Is, that he was the lord ambassador

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sent from a sort of tinkers to the king.

speaker: Commons
text_entry: [Within]  An answer from the king, or we will all break in!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Go, Salisbury, and tell them all from me.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I thank them for their tender loving care;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And had I not been cited so by them,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Yet did I purpose as they do entreat;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For, sure, my thoughts do hourly prophesy

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Mischance unto my state by Suffolk's means:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And therefore, by His majesty I swear,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whose far unworthy deputy I am,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: He shall not breathe infection in this air

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But three days longer, on the pain of death.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Exit SALISBURY

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: O Henry, let me plead for gentle Suffolk!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Ungentle queen, to call him gentle Suffolk!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: No more, I say: if thou dost plead for him,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Thou wilt but add increase unto my wrath.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Had I but said, I would have kept my word,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But when I swear, it is irrevocable.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If, after three days' space, thou here be'st found

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: On any ground that I am ruler of,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The world shall not be ransom for thy life.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Come, Warwick, come, good Warwick, go with me;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I have great matters to impart to thee.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Exeunt all but QUEEN MARGARET and SUFFOLK

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Mischance and sorrow go along with you!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Heart's discontent and sour affliction

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Be playfellows to keep you company!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: There's two of you; the devil make a third!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And threefold vengeance tend upon your steps!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Cease, gentle queen, these execrations,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And let thy Suffolk take his heavy leave.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Fie, coward woman and soft-hearted wretch!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Hast thou not spirit to curse thine enemy?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A plague upon them! wherefore should I curse them?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Would curses kill, as doth the mandrake's groan,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I would invent as bitter-searching terms,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As curst, as harsh and horrible to hear,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Deliver'd strongly through my fixed teeth,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: With full as many signs of deadly hate,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As lean-faced Envy in her loathsome cave:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: My tongue should stumble in mine earnest words;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Mine eyes should sparkle like the beaten flint;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Mine hair be fixed on end, as one distract;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Ay, every joint should seem to curse and ban:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And even now my burthen'd heart would break,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Should I not curse them. Poison be their drink!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Gall, worse than gall, the daintiest that they taste!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Their sweetest shade a grove of cypress trees!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Their chiefest prospect murdering basilisks!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Their softest touch as smart as lizards' sting!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Their music frightful as the serpent's hiss,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And boding screech-owls make the concert full!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: All the foul terrors in dark-seated hell--

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Enough, sweet Suffolk; thou torment'st thyself;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And these dread curses, like the sun 'gainst glass,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or like an overcharged gun, recoil,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And turn the force of them upon thyself.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: You bade me ban, and will you bid me leave?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Now, by the ground that I am banish'd from,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Well could I curse away a winter's night,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Though standing naked on a mountain top,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Where biting cold would never let grass grow,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And think it but a minute spent in sport.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: O, let me entreat thee cease. Give me thy hand,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That I may dew it with my mournful tears;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Nor let the rain of heaven wet this place,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To wash away my woful monuments.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: O, could this kiss be printed in thy hand,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That thou mightst think upon these by the seal,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Through whom a thousand sighs are breathed for thee!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: So, get thee gone, that I may know my grief;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: 'Tis but surmised whiles thou art standing by,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: As one that surfeits thinking on a want.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I will repeal thee, or, be well assured,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Adventure to be banished myself:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And banished I am, if but from thee.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Go; speak not to me; even now be gone.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: O, go not yet! Even thus two friends condemn'd

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Embrace and kiss and take ten thousand leaves,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Loather a hundred times to part than die.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Yet now farewell; and farewell life with thee!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thus is poor Suffolk ten times banished;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Once by the king, and three times thrice by thee.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: 'Tis not the land I care for, wert thou thence;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A wilderness is populous enough,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So Suffolk had thy heavenly company:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For where thou art, there is the world itself,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: With every several pleasure in the world,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And where thou art not, desolation.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I can no more: live thou to joy thy life;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Myself no joy in nought but that thou livest.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Enter VAUX

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Wither goes Vaux so fast? what news, I prithee?

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: To signify unto his majesty

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: That Cardinal Beaufort is at point of death;

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: For suddenly a grievous sickness took him,

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: That makes him gasp and stare and catch the air,

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: Blaspheming God and cursing men on earth.

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: Sometimes he talks as if Duke Humphrey's ghost

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: Were by his side; sometime he calls the king,

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: And whispers to his pillow, as to him,

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: The secrets of his overcharged soul;

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: And I am sent to tell his majesty

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: That even now he cries aloud for him.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Go tell this heavy message to the king.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Exit VAUX

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Ay me! what is this world! what news are these!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But wherefore grieve I at an hour's poor loss,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Omitting Suffolk's exile, my soul's treasure?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Why only, Suffolk, mourn I not for thee,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And with the southern clouds contend in tears,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Theirs for the earth's increase, mine for my sorrows?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Now get thee hence: the king, thou know'st, is coming;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If thou be found by me, thou art but dead.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If I depart from thee, I cannot live;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And in thy sight to die, what were it else

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But like a pleasant slumber in thy lap?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Here could I breathe my soul into the air,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As mild and gentle as the cradle-babe

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Dying with mother's dug between its lips:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Where, from thy sight, I should be raging mad,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And cry out for thee to close up mine eyes,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To have thee with thy lips to stop my mouth;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So shouldst thou either turn my flying soul,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Or I should breathe it so into thy body,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And then it lived in sweet Elysium.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To die by thee were but to die in jest;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: From thee to die were torture more than death:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: O, let me stay, befall what may befall!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Away! though parting be a fretful corrosive,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: It is applied to a deathful wound.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To France, sweet Suffolk: let me hear from thee;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: For wheresoe'er thou art in this world's globe,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I'll have an Iris that shall find thee out.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I go.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And take my heart with thee.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A jewel, lock'd into the wofull'st cask

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That ever did contain a thing of worth.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Even as a splitted bark, so sunder we

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: This way fall I to death.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: This way for me.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Exeunt severally
